18#include "ODCodabarWriter.h"
19#include "ODWriterHelper.h"
20#include "ZXContainerAlgorithms.h"
21
22#include <stdexcept>
23#include <vector>
24
25namespace ZXing {
26namespace OneD {
27
28static constexpr wchar_t START_END_CHARS[] = L"ABCD";
29static constexpr wchar_t ALT_START_END_CHARS[] = L"TN*E";
30static constexpr wchar_t CHARS_WHICH_ARE_TEN_LENGTH_EACH_AFTER_DECODED[] = L"/:+.";
31static constexpr wchar_t DEFAULT_GUARD = START_END_CHARS[0];
32
33static constexpr wchar_t ALPHABET[] = L"0123456789-$:/.+ABCD";
34
35static constexpr int WIDE_TO_NARROW_BAR_RATIO = 2; //TODO: spec says 2.25 to 3 is the valid range. So this is technically illformed.
36
37/**
38* These represent the encodings of characters, as patterns of wide and narrow bars. The 7 least-significant bits of
39* each int correspond to the pattern of wide and narrow, with 1s representing "wide" and 0s representing narrow.
40*/
41static const int CHARACTER_ENCODINGS[] = {
42 0x003, 0x006, 0x009, 0x060, 0x012, 0x042, 0x021, 0x024, 0x030, 0x048, // 0-9
43 0x00c, 0x018, 0x045, 0x051, 0x054, 0x015, 0x01A, 0x029, 0x00B, 0x00E, // -$:/.+ABCD
44};
45
46static_assert(Size(ALPHABET) - 1 == Size(CHARACTER_ENCODINGS), "table size mismatch");
47
48BitMatrix
49CodabarWriter::encode(const std::wstring& contents_, int width, int height) const
50{
51 std::wstring contents = contents_;
52 if (contents.empty()) {
53 throw std::invalid_argument("Found empty contents");
54 }
55 if (contents.length() < 2) {
56 // Can't have a start/end guard, so tentatively add default guards
57 contents = DEFAULT_GUARD + contents + DEFAULT_GUARD;
58 }
59 else {
60 // Verify input and calculate decoded length.
61 bool startsNormal = Contains(START_END_CHARS, contents.front());
62 bool endsNormal = Contains(START_END_CHARS, contents.back());
63 bool startsAlt = Contains(ALT_START_END_CHARS, contents.front());
64 bool endsAlt = Contains(ALT_START_END_CHARS, contents.back());
65 if (startsNormal) {
66 if (!endsNormal) {
67 throw std::invalid_argument("Invalid start/end guards");
68 }
69 // else already has valid start/end
70 }
71 else if (startsAlt) {
72 if (!endsAlt) {
73 throw std::invalid_argument("Invalid start/end guards");
74 }
75 // else already has valid start/end
76
77 // map alt characters to normal once so they are found in the ALPHABET
78 auto map_alt_guard_char = [](wchar_t& c) {
79 switch (c) {
80 case 'T': c = 'A'; break;
81 case 'N': c = 'B'; break;
82 case '*': c = 'C'; break;
83 case 'E': c = 'D'; break;
84 }
85 };
86 map_alt_guard_char(contents.front());
87 map_alt_guard_char(contents.back());
88 }
89 else {
90 // Doesn't start with a guard
91 if (endsNormal || endsAlt) {
92 throw std::invalid_argument("Invalid start/end guards");
93 }
94 // else doesn't end with guard either, so add a default
95 contents = DEFAULT_GUARD + contents + DEFAULT_GUARD;
96 }
97 }
98
99 // The start character and the end character are decoded to 10 length each.
100 size_t resultLength = 20;
101 for (size_t i = 1; i + 1 < contents.length(); ++i) {
102 auto c = contents[i];
103 if ((c >= '0' && c <= '9') || c == '-' || c == '$') {
104 resultLength += 9;
105 }
106 else if (Contains(CHARS_WHICH_ARE_TEN_LENGTH_EACH_AFTER_DECODED, c)) {
107 resultLength += 10;
108 }
109 else {
110 throw std::invalid_argument(std::string("Cannot encode : '") + static_cast<char>(c) + std::string("'"));
111 }
112 }
113 // A blank is placed between each character.
114 resultLength += contents.length() - 1;
115
116 std::vector<bool> result(resultLength, false);
117 auto position = result.begin();
118 for (wchar_t c : contents) {
119 int code = CHARACTER_ENCODINGS[IndexOf(ALPHABET, c)]; // c is checked above to be in ALPHABET
120 bool isBlack = true;
121 int counter = 0; // count the width of the current bar
122 int bit = 0;
123 while (bit < 7) { // A character consists of 7 digit.
124 *position++ = isBlack;
125 ++counter;
126 if (((code >> (6 - bit)) & 1) == 0 || counter == WIDE_TO_NARROW_BAR_RATIO) { // if current bar is short or we
127 isBlack = !isBlack; // Flip the color.
128 bit++;
129 counter = 0;
130 }
131 }
132 if (position != result.end()) {
133 *position++ = false; // inter character whitespace
134 }
135 }
136
137 return WriterHelper::RenderResult(result, width, height, _sidesMargin >= 0 ? _sidesMargin : 10);
138}
139
140} // OneD
141} // ZXing
142
